Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Dr. T. Kenjitsu Nakagaki, Buddhist Council of New York.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Garodnick.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Dr. T. Kenjitsu Nakagaki, Buddhist Council of New York.

Council Member Garodnick moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 13, 2016 be adopted as printed by Council Member Garodnick.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Garodnick moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 13, 2016 be adopted as printed.

Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution approving an exemption from real property taxes for property located at (Block 1433, Lot 35) Brooklyn, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 520).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 520 - 2178 Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: Resolution approving an exemption from real property taxes for property located at (Block 9793, part of Lot 78 (a/k/a Tentative Lot 79)) Queens, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 521).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 521 - The Tree of Life, Queens

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Fire and Criminal

A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the investigation, review, study, audit of, and recommendations relating to, the operations, policies, programs and practices of the department of correction by the commissioner of the department of investigation
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Investigation, review, study, audit of, and recommendations relating to, the operations, policies, programs and practices of the DOC by the commissioner of DOI.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Higher Education
A Local Law to establish a task force on affordability, admissions, and graduation rates at the City University of New York
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish a task force on affordability, admissions, and graduation rates at CUNY.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Housing and Buildings
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a qualification for gas work
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Qualification for gas work.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to final inspections of gas piping systems
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Final inspections of gas piping systems.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to periodic inspections of gas piping systems
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Periodic inspections of gas piping systems.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring owners to provide notice to their tenants regarding procedures that should be followed when a gas leak is suspected
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring owners to provide notice to their tenants regarding procedures that should be followed when a gas leak is suspected.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring gas service providers and owners to notify the department of buildings within twenty-four hours when gas service is shut-off or not restored due to safety concerns
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring gas service providers and owners to notify the DOB within 24 hours when gas service is shut-off or not restored due to safety concerns.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to identifying the factors indicating gas-related violations in residential and commercial buildings
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Identifying the factors indicating gas-related violations in residential and commercial buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring annual reports on the state of gas infrastructure in the city
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring annual reports on the state of gas infrastructure in the city.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city housing maintenance code and the New York city building code, in relation to requiring the installation of natural gas detecting devices, and to repeal sections 27-2045, 27-2046, 27-2046.1 and 27-2046.2 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to smoke detecting devices and carbon monoxide detecting devices
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Smoke detecting devices and carbon monoxide detecting devices.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a temporary waiver of penalties for violations relating to fuel gas piping systems and appliances that are promptly repaired
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Temporary waiver of penalties for violations relating to fuel gas piping systems and appliances that are promptly repaired.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating violations of existing law regarding gas piping systems as “immediately hazardous”
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Designating violations of existing law regarding gas piping systems as “immediately hazardous”.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to conflicts of interest and organizations affiliated with elected officials
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Standards and Ethics
Items.MatterName: Conflicts of interest and organizations affiliated with elected officials.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.5982 and S.6342 to prohibit employers from seeking the salary history of a prospective employee for an interview or as a condition of employment
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Prohibit employers from seeking the salary history of a prospective employee for an interview or as a condition of employment. (A.5982/S.6342)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to provide inmates vocational or educational programming
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOC to provide inmates vocational or educational programming.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to distribute information regarding the gifted and talented programs and exam
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign Rory Staunton's law, legislation directing the New York State Commissioner of Education to establish rules and regulations for a sepsis awareness and prevention program for schools, and the New York City Department of Education to develop and disseminate a comprehensive sepsis curriculum
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Rory Staunton's Law

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget

The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 50 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.

Items.Title: Application No. C 160054 MMK submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development and the New York City Economic Development Corporation pursuant to Sections 197-c and 199 of the New York City Charter for an amendment to the City Map involving the elimination, discontinuance and closing of a portion of Flatbush Avenue Extension and its intersection with Gold Street, Borough of Brooklyn, Community Board 2, Council District 33. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to Charter Section 197-d(b)(2) or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to Charter Section 197-d(b)(3).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 141 WILLOUGHBY STREET REZONING, Brooklyn (C160054 MMK, C160030 ZMK, N160029 ZRK)

Items.Title: Application No. C 150312 ZMX submitted by Upper Manhattan Development Corporation, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 6a, changing an existing C8-3 district to an R7D and R8 district and establishing a C1-4 district within the proposed R7D district, on property located in the vicinity of Grand Concourse and Concourse Village West, Borough of the Bronx, Community Board 4, Council District 17.

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Tuesday, November 29, 2016.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
